definition[0]: to state that something is correct or true, especially after some kind of test
example[0]: The accounts were certified by an auditor.
example[1]: The driver was certified dead at the scene.
example[2]: We need to certify that the repairs have been satisfactorily carried out.
definition[1]: to give an official paper to someone which states that they have completed a course of training for a profession
example[3]: She was certified as a teacher in 1990.
definition[2]: to officially state that someone is mentally ill
definition[3]: to state that something is correct or suitable, especially after an official check or test
example[4]: Every delivery must be certified for consistent quality.
example[5]: The farm has not yet been certified organic.
definition[4]: to give an official paper to someone that states they have completed a course of training for a profession
example[6]: She was certified as an accountant in 1996.
